list.name: Default
list.comment: UI change - the 'console' button for a VM is now in the row of the VM itself in the data grid, instead of being a button outside of the data grid (then the VM has to be selected before the console button can be clicked). It makes more sense, because opening a console can be done only for a single VM, and not for several (which justifies the button being external).

task.summary: Default task

This is a rather big revision... I add a server app, written in nodejs. Currently it can offer a RESTful API, and for classes - it also stores the data in a mongodb.
I changed some of the AngularJS code as well, to conform to the existence of the server (some of it wasn't correct, as I was working with deflect.io mocks).
Removing unnecessary code that came from the nodejs template project.
I add the server-side handling of courses with the mongodb, with equivalent little client-side changes (like updating the course in the client after they are persisted in the db).
Converting the classes flow to the more robust logic, of controller-dal-model, with decoupling and promises.

The server now saves the students of each class as separate users, so that the login process can run against that store of users (instead of searching for the login in the students lists of the classes.
Continuing with making sure the students are also saved separately as users.
Introducing mocks in the server side, so that development can continue while the server is not fully functional.
Mocks for the student flow.
Adding HTTP response status codes for failures.

Enabling trainer login, by saving its ravello credentials in the DB, so that actions done against Ravello from the trainer flow will work. This means mostly getting the blueprints, so that the trainer can edit courses.
Fixing the date formatting in both client and server side.
Fixing some bugs regarding the additional information of VMs in an app.
Adding more data to the DB, this time specific data for a client environment.
Setting the autoStop to 'never' for now, so that we don't have to deal with the autoStop during a demo to one of the clients.
Fixing another bug of the DNS not shown for the VMs in the student's page of a single app.

1. Fixing the HTTP status codes returned for various classes/courses actions.
2. Fixing the routing when trying to access a URL with wrong credentials.
Protecting the data, in case there are no dates provided for a class.
Protecting the data, in case there are no dates provided for a class.

UI change - the 'console' button for a VM is now in the row of the VM itself in the data grid, instead of being a button outside of the data grid (then the VM has to be selected before the console button can be clicked). It makes more sense, because opening a console can be done only for a single VM, and not for several (which justifies the button being external).
Fixing a bug of associating a student and its class. Up until now, we would've gotten the info that's relevant for the 1st student in the class, regardless of the logged in user.

Solving problems in how the classes/courses/students are saved. The main problem was with the update - instead of performing an update against mongoose and getting the new entity back (with new _id properties in case of upsert) - we now perform an update with no result, and then read the entity again from scratch.
Solve the fqdn bug - during iteration over a VM's network connections, I was taking also devices that don't have a public IP.
Reorganizing the authentication and authorization code.
Fixing a bug with showing the DNS with external services - I missed the nics with static IPs.
Fixing a bug with showing the DNS with external services - I missed the nics with static IPs.
Applying the auto stop logic for the 'start/stop all' buttons.
Refactoring the code, using the promises in a more concise (and hopefully more readable) way (using q.all and _.map)

Refactor - conforming the relationship between DAL and controller in the server. The idea is that the DAL return full mongo entities, and the controller is responsible for transforming them to whatever needed.

Solving the issue with the ngQuickDate lib - it had a directive name clash with ui-bootstrap, for the 'datepicker' directive. For some unknown reason, the maintainer of ngQuickDate does not change the directive name, even though there's an open issue about it. Up until now, I changed the directive name directly in the dist file after installing the original lib with bower. That's annoying obviously, so now I forked the original ngQuickDate project and changed the directive name to 'ngDate'. I now reference our project's dependency to the new forked ngQuickDate project with the directive name changed. Currently this forked project lies in my own github account, hopefully we can move it to Ravello's.

Begining the flow for creating apps from the trainer view, for the students in a class. Currently, the button to create an app is there, and accesses the server to create the app, but the app is not published yet, and the result is not returned yet.
Simplifying the way I create the DTO for the student when he first logins. Mapping the student to its class, and finding the BP permissions for that student, is simpler now.
Forgot to include the class description in the DB.
Solving a little bug with the passwords when creating a new class (therefore going to POST action instead of PUT).

1. Introducing the admin page.
2. Currently only implementing the part that enables the admin to edit its own profile (username and password).

MESSAGE.value: Adding HTTP response status codes for failures.

Enabling trainer login, by saving its ravello credentials in the DB, so that actions done against Ravello from the trainer flow will work. This means mostly getting the blueprints, so that the trainer can edit courses.
Fixing the date formatting in both client and server side.
Fixing some bugs regarding the additional information of VMs in an app.
Adding more data to the DB, this time specific data for a client environment.
Setting the autoStop to 'never' for now, so that we don't have to deal with the autoStop during a demo to one of the clients.
Fixing another bug of the DNS not shown for the VMs in the student's page of a single app.

1. Fixing the HTTP status codes returned for various classes/courses actions.
2. Fixing the routing when trying to access a URL with wrong credentials.
Protecting the data, in case there are no dates provided for a class.

UI change - the 'console' button for a VM is now in the row of the VM itself in the data grid, instead of being a button outside of the data grid (then the VM has to be selected before the console button can be clicked). It makes more sense, because opening a console can be done only for a single VM, and not for several (which justifies the button being external).
Fixing a bug of associating a student and its class. Up until now, we would've gotten the info that's relevant for the 1st student in the class, regardless of the logged in user.

Solving problems in how the classes/courses/students are saved. The main problem was with the update - instead of performing an update against mongoose and getting the new entity back (with new _id properties in case of upsert) - we now perform an update with no result, and then read the entity again from scratch.
Solve the fqdn bug - during iteration over a VM's network connections, I was taking also devices that don't have a public IP.
Reorganizing the authentication and authorization code.
Fixing a bug with showing the DNS with external services - I missed the nics with static IPs.
Applying the auto stop logic for the 'start/stop all' buttons.
Refactoring the code, using the promises in a more concise (and hopefully more readable) way (using q.all and _.map)

Refactor - conforming the relationship between DAL and controller in the server. The idea is that the DAL return full mongo entities, and the controller is responsible for transforming them to whatever needed.

Solving the issue with the ngQuickDate lib - it had a directive name clash with ui-bootstrap, for the 'datepicker' directive. For some unknown reason, the maintainer of ngQuickDate does not change the directive name, even though there's an open issue about it. Up until now, I changed the directive name directly in the dist file after installing the original lib with bower. That's annoying obviously, so now I forked the original ngQuickDate project and changed the directive name to 'ngDate'. I now reference our project's dependency to the new forked ngQuickDate project with the directive name changed. Currently this forked project lies in my own github account, hopefully we can move it to Ravello's.

Begining the flow for creating apps from the trainer view, for the students in a class. Currently, the button to create an app is there, and accesses the server to create the app, but the app is not published yet, and the result is not returned yet.
Simplifying the way I create the DTO for the student when he first logins. Mapping the student to its class, and finding the BP permissions for that student, is simpler now.
Forgot to include the class description in the DB.
Solving a little bug with the passwords when creating a new class (therefore going to POST action instead of PUT).

1. Introducing the admin page.
2. Currently only implementing the part that enables the admin to edit its own profile (username and password).
